alert.note: Alert for Chenango; Cortland; Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga; Otsego; Seneca; Southern Cayuga; Southern Oneida (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 7:57AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...PATCHY FREEZING DRIZZLE POSSIBLE THIS MORNING OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS... A mix of light snow and patchy freezing drizzle will move through north central New York between 8 am and 10 am. Locations along the Thruway west of Oneida County and along Interstate 81 in the Syracuse area are above freezing and are not expected to have any icy conditions. The higher terrain along Interstate I-81 south of Syracuse down into Cortland County could see some icy spots. Likewise, portions of the Thruway in Oneida County also could see a few patches of ice. Secondary roads and other state and county highways through the higher terrain from southern Seneca and southern Cayuga Counties through southern Onondaga, Cortland, Chenango, Madison and Otsego counties also could see some patchy ice this morning. Expect temperatures to climb above freezing by 11 am or so. Motorists traveling in the higher terrain, along I-81 between Syracuse and Cortland and on the Thruway in Oneida County should watch out for patchy ice on roadways. Slow down and allow for extra time to reach your destination.

area.areaDesc: Chenango; Cortland; Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga; Otsego; Seneca; Southern Cayuga; Southern Oneida
